name: Mini Elixir Ultime Hydrating Hair Oil
about: What it is: A new and improved luxurious formula of the iconic hair oil, now refillable, formulated with wild camellia to smooth frizz and enhance shine, while nourishing and protecting against heat up to 450°F...Hair Texture: Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily..Hair Type: Fine, Medium, and Thick..Hair Concerns:- Frizz.- Heat Protection.- Shine..Key Benefits:.- Leaves hair smoother and irresistibly soft.- Enhances hair shine and reduces frizz.- Strengthens and provides heat protection up to 450°F..Highlighted Ingredients:- Wild Camellia Flower: Resilient flower with high concentration of antioxidants to nourish hair...What Else You Need to Know:  Achieve radiant shine with the new and improved formula of the iconic hair oil infused with wild camellia, loved and recommended by pros and consumer worldwide. This lightweight oil provides 92 percent more shine**, and up to 10x smoother* and 10x stronger* hair. This luxurious hair oil controls frizz up to 96 hours, strengthens hair, and provides heat protection up to 450°F. This multi-benefit oil can be used as an instant conditioning treatment to deeply nourish hair, a styling aid to reduce frizz, or a finishing touch to your final style for shiny and soft hair...The new iconic hair oil is now refillable. The bottle is made of least 30% recycled glass**** and the refill is made of at least 95% recycled plastic.***..Fragrance Description: The top notes are Mandarin and freesia violet leaves; middle notes are cedarwood and heliotrope violet flower; and bottom notes are sandalwood musk and courarine.0..Clinical Results:.This lightweight oil provides up to 92% more shine**, up to 10x smoother* and up to 10x stronger* hair..*vs non-conditioning shampoo.**vs unwashed hair.***Except the cap, the pump, the label.**** Except Cap and pump.
ingredients: -Wild Camellia Flower: Resilient flower with high concentration of antioxidants to nourish hair...Isododecane, Dimethicone, C11-13 Isoalkane, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Dimethiconol, Amodimethicone, Camellia Oleifera Seed Oil, Zea Mays Germ Oil/Corn Germ Oil, Argania Spinosa Kernel Oil, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Pentaclethra Macroloba Seed Oil, Camelina Sativa Seed Oil, Linalool, Alpha-Isomethyl Ionone, Limonene, Coumarin, Benzyl Alcohol, Camellia Japonica Flower Extract, Phyllanthus Emblica Fruit Extract, Tocopherol, Parfum/Fragrance.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:..-Apply one to two pumps on mid-lengths and ends to bring a touch of shine during your styling routine..-Use as often as needed. Can be used on wet or dry hair, based on your preference....How to Refill: .-To refill, unscrew your empty oil refill and separate it from the glass bottle..-Unbox your new oil refill and insert into the glass bottle..-Turn clockwise to lock...Recycling Instructions:.-The bottle is made of least 30 percent recycled glass (except cap and pump) and the refill is made of at least 95% recycled plastic (except cap, pump, label).

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The smell isn’t over powering at all.  I love adding this into my routine for shine and hydration! It doesn’t weigh down my curls either.  It wouldn’t be my first option to fight  frizz .

I have been using this hair oil for years and was shocked when I recently purchased this new bottle from sephora. Kerastatse changed their formula to what feels like a watered down version of the previous hair oil, price went from $20 to $30 and it's literal trash. The hair oil used to be the perfect amount of thick and luxurious and would leave my hair soft and shiny. This new formula is pure liquid, feels like water in your hands and does nothing at all for my hair. This new hair oil feels like a watered down version of their previous hair oil. Super disappointed as this was my go-to hair oil and will need to switch to a different brand. The price also went up 33%. This bottle used to cost $20 at sephora and now costs $30 and the product is total garbage now. I have no issue paying $30 for hair oil if the product was worth the cost but this hair oil formula is completely different and embarrassing on Kerastase if they didn't think consumers would notice they cut corners on their new formula. Do not buy. If you want higher end hair oil, switch over to Shu Uemera.

reviews.review_title: New formula, new price, worsened results
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I tried the original one in the glass bottle and it was amazing. The concentration was lighter and it smelled amazing! I could not keep my hands out of my hair. The “new formula” feels a little more dense. The smell is a bit odd. Plus the increase in price is really a dealbreaker. I wouldn’t have minded paying the increase if it still offered that amazing formula. But it just seems like they’re cheapening out the quality of the product just to make a few extra dollars. I will not be buying this new version. I’m sure there’s better options on the market. If they kept old formula absolutely! But this isn’t worth the price and quality.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product free from influenster in exchange for my honest review. Kerastase is a well-known hair care product brand especially for those of us who damage our hair with bleach. The packaging is very nice and sleek and looks great on your vanity. My one complaint is that I had to look up directions on how to use it because they are absolutely tiny on the box. Some oils are better off being put on while wet and others are best on dry hair. This particular oil you can use on damp or dry hair. I absolutely love the way my hair feels afterwards. I use it on damp hair and I start my ends and work my way up to the roots. My hair is damaged because I bleach it and add fantasy colors. This makes it feel like I have absolutely no damage to my hair. It smells absolutely wonderful with a gourmand scent that does not overwhelm your senses. This is my second product from Kerastase and both have an absolutely amazing. I do have to say it can be on the pricey side but you do not need to use much of the product to get the results that you want.
